availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Phillips (Bath County, Kentucky, physician and soldier)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, physician and soldier. Kentucky native. So of W.O. Phillips and Myrtilda Phillips. Graduate of the University of Louisville in Louisville Kentucky, on February 27, 1857. Graduate of the Ohio Medical College in Cincinnati, Ohio on March 1, 1860. Sawyer in Mason County, Kentucky in 1850. Attorney in Fleming County, Kentucky in 1860. Registered with the Union Army in September, 1863 as an unmarried physician, along with his father,who was also a physician. Served as surgeon for the 39th and the 40th Kentucky Infantry.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 54A
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 2, p. 618.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Poplar Plains, p. 495A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), 9th Congressional District, KY, September, 1863, p. 83 of microfilm, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
The Lexington Intelligencer(Lexington, Missouri), October 3, 1913, page 8.
